intro: Isolepis leucoloma, commonly known as the white-flowered tussock grass, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. The plant is characterized by its dense, tufted growth habit and narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowering stems produce small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in summer. Isolepis leucoloma is often found in moist, well-drained soils in wetlands or along stream banks.
